title: Teaching at Cal Poly Humboldt
text:
I’m an Associate Professor in the Mathematics Department at Cal Poly Humboldt, California’s newest polytechnic university. Previously, I taught at Oregon Institute of Technology. I have also worked as a statistician at UC San Diego’s Clinical and Translational Research Institute, Ghent University (Belgium), and Umea University (Sweden). I hold a Ph.D. in mathematics from UCSD, a B.S. in mathematics from Cal Poly San Luis Obispo and an A.S. in mathematics from Bakersfield Community College.
I’m passionate about helping students develop both theoretical understanding and practical skills that prepare them for thoughtful and rewarding careers.

title: Teaching at Cal Poly Humboldt
text:
Our Campus
Cal Poly Humboldt is located on California’s North Coast. Our campus sits between the Pacific Ocean and redwood forests, providing a unique learning environment that inspires both academic excellence and environmental stewardship. This setting influences our approach to education, emphasizing hands-on learning, environmental awareness, and community engagement.

title: Teaching at Cal Poly Humboldt
text:
Current Teaching

DATA 311: Applied Data Analysis
Applied Data Analysis - A hands-on course to apply your knowledge of database design, data visualization, and predictive modeling to solve real-world problems.
